page.title: 02Landscape In Jedburgh
page.content: The main feature of the area is the River Jed.It flows north through the western part of our block.The A.68 more or less follows its course along part of the valley.In many places one bank rises very steeply whereas the other is flat ground known as a haugh in Scotland.Just outside the town the escarpments,referred to locally as scaurs,reveal the red sandstone underlying the area.There are numerous small wooded glens with tiny streams. When one has climbed out of the valley there is rolling countryside to the east.The urban landscape is dominated by the Abbey,on its small rise facing south,and by the Castle Jail sited high above the town.
